intro: Trachynia beludshistanica, commonly known as the Kashmir snowbean, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
